title: The warlord Zhu Quanzhong kills Emperor Zhaozong, the penultimate emperor of the Tang dynasty, after seizing control of the imperial government.
text: The warlord Zhu Quanzhong kills Emperor Zhaozong, the penultimate emperor of the Tang dynasty, after seizing control of the imperial government.

title: The Lithuanians and Semigallians defeat the Livonian Brothers of the Sword in the Battle of Saule.
text: The Lithuanians and Semigallians defeat the Livonian Brothers of the Sword in the Battle of Saule.

title: Treaty of Basel concludes the Swabian War.
text: Treaty of Basel concludes the Swabian War.

title: Battle of Zutphen: Spanish victory over the English and Dutch.
text: Battle of Zutphen: Spanish victory over the English and Dutch.

title: English playwright Ben Jonson kills actor Gabriel Spenser in a duel and is indicted for manslaughter.
text: English playwright Ben Jonson kills actor Gabriel Spenser in a duel and is indicted for manslaughter.

title: The last of those convicted of witchcraft in the Salem witch trials are hanged; the remainder of those convicted are all eventually released.
text: The last of those convicted of witchcraft in the Salem witch trials are hanged; the remainder of those convicted are all eventually released.

title: The Tuscarora War begins in present-day North Carolina.
text: The Tuscarora War begins in present-day North Carolina.

title: George III and Charlotte of Mecklenburg-Strelitz are crowned King and Queen, respectively, of the Kingdom of Great Britain.
text: George III and Charlotte of Mecklenburg-Strelitz are crowned King and Queen, respectively, of the Kingdom of Great Britain.

title: Nathan Hale is hanged for spying during American Revolution.
text: Nathan Hale is hanged for spying during American Revolution.

title: The office of United States Postmaster General is established.
text: The office of United States Postmaster General is established.

title: Battle of Rymnik establishes Alexander Suvorov as a pre-eminent Russian military commander after his allied army defeat superior Ottoman Empire forces.
text: Battle of Rymnik establishes Alexander Suvorov as a pre-eminent Russian military commander after his allied army defeat superior Ottoman Empire forces.

title: Primidi Vendémiaire of year one of the French Republican Calendar as the French First Republic comes into being.
text: Primidi Vendémiaire of year one of the French Republican Calendar as the French First Republic comes into being.

title: Joseph Smith states he found the golden plates on this date after being directed by God through the Angel Moroni to the place where they were buried.
text: Joseph Smith states he found the golden plates on this date after being directed by God through the Angel Moroni to the place where they were buried.

title: The Russian warship Lefort capsizes and sinks during a storm in the Gulf of Finland, killing all 826 aboard.
text: The Russian warship Lefort capsizes and sinks during a storm in the Gulf of Finland, killing all 826 aboard.

title: Slavery in the United States: A preliminary version of the Emancipation Proclamation is released.
text: Slavery in the United States: A preliminary version of the Emancipation Proclamation is released.

title: Battle of Curupayty in the Paraguayan War.
text: Battle of Curupayty in the Paraguayan War.

title: Lord Randolph Churchill makes a speech in Ulster in opposition to Home Rule.
text: Lord Randolph Churchill makes a speech in Ulster in opposition to Home Rule.

title: The first issue of National Geographic Magazine is published.
text: The first issue of National Geographic Magazine is published.

title: Lindal Railway Incident, providing inspiration for "The Lost Special" by A.C. Doyle and the TV serial Lost.
text: Lindal Railway Incident, providing inspiration for "The Lost Special" by A.C. Doyle and the TV serial Lost.

title: Queen Victoria surpasses her grandfather King George III as the longest reigning monarch in British history.
text: Queen Victoria surpasses her grandfather King George III as the longest reigning monarch in British history.

title: The Duke of York's Picture House opens in Brighton, now the oldest continually operating cinema in Britain.
text: The Duke of York's Picture House opens in Brighton, now the oldest continually operating cinema in Britain.

title: German submarine SM U-9 torpedoes and sinks the British cruisers HMS Aboukir, Hogue and Cressy on the Broad Fourteens off the Dutch coast with the loss of over 1,400 men.
text: German submarine SM U-9 torpedoes and sinks the British cruisers HMS Aboukir, Hogue and Cressy on the Broad Fourteens off the Dutch coast with the loss of over 1,400 men.

title: The steel strike of 1919, led by the Amalgamated Association of Iron and Steel Workers, begins in Pennsylvania before spreading across the United States.
text: The steel strike of 1919, led by the Amalgamated Association of Iron and Steel Workers, begins in Pennsylvania before spreading across the United States.

title: Jack Dempsey loses the "Long Count" boxing match to Gene Tunney.
text: Jack Dempsey loses the "Long Count" boxing match to Gene Tunney.

title: An explosion takes place at Gresford Colliery in Wales, leading to the deaths of 266 miners and rescuers.
text: An explosion takes place at Gresford Colliery in Wales, leading to the deaths of 266 miners and rescuers.

title: Spanish Civil War: Peña Blanca is taken, ending the Battle of El Mazuco.
text: Spanish Civil War: Peña Blanca is taken, ending the Battle of El Mazuco.

title: World War II: Joint victory parade of Wehrmacht and Red Army in Brest-Litovsk at the end of the Invasion of Poland.
text: World War II: Joint victory parade of Wehrmacht and Red Army in Brest-Litovsk at the end of the Invasion of Poland.

title: The Holocaust in Ukraine: On Jewish New Year Day, the German SS murder 6,000 Jews in Vinnytsia, Ukraine. Those are the survivors of the previous killings that took place a few days earlier in which about 24,000 Jews were executed.
text: The Holocaust in Ukraine: On Jewish New Year Day, the German SS murder 6,000 Jews in Vinnytsia, Ukraine. Those are the survivors of the previous killings that took place a few days earlier in which about 24,000 Jews were executed.

title: Gail Halvorsen officially started parachuting candy to children as part of the Berlin Air lift.
text: Gail Halvorsen officially started parachuting candy to children as part of the Berlin Air lift.

title: In Haiti, François Duvalier is elected president.
text: In Haiti, François Duvalier is elected president.

title: The Sudanese Republic is renamed Mali after the withdrawal of Senegal from the Mali Federation.
text: The Sudanese Republic is renamed Mali after the withdrawal of Senegal from the Mali Federation.

title: The Indo-Pakistani War of 1965 (also known as the Second Kashmir War) between India and Pakistan over Kashmir, ends after the UN calls for a ceasefire.
text: The Indo-Pakistani War of 1965 (also known as the Second Kashmir War) between India and Pakistan over Kashmir, ends after the UN calls for a ceasefire.

title: Sara Jane Moore tries to assassinate U.S. President Gerald Ford, but is foiled by Secret Service agent Oliver Sipple.
text: Sara Jane Moore tries to assassinate U.S. President Gerald Ford, but is foiled by Secret Service agent Oliver Sipple.

title: A bright flash, resembling the detonation of a nuclear weapon, is observed near the Prince Edward Islands. Its cause is never determined.
text: A bright flash, resembling the detonation of a nuclear weapon, is observed near the Prince Edward Islands. Its cause is never determined.

title: Iran–Iraq War: Iraq invades Iran.
text: Iran–Iraq War: Iraq invades Iran.

title: The Dead Sea Scrolls are made available to the public for the first time by the Huntington Library.
text: The Dead Sea Scrolls are made available to the public for the first time by the Huntington Library.

title: A barge strikes a railroad bridge near Mobile, Alabama, causing the deadliest train wreck in Amtrak history. Forty-seven passengers are killed.
text: A barge strikes a railroad bridge near Mobile, Alabama, causing the deadliest train wreck in Amtrak history. Forty-seven passengers are killed.

title: A Transair Georgian Airlines Tu-154 is shot down by a missile in Sukhumi, Georgia.
text: A Transair Georgian Airlines Tu-154 is shot down by a missile in Sukhumi, Georgia.

title: An E-3B AWACS crashes outside Elmendorf Air Force Base, Alaska after multiple bird strikes to two of the four engines soon after takeoff; all 24 on board are killed.
text: An E-3B AWACS crashes outside Elmendorf Air Force Base, Alaska after multiple bird strikes to two of the four engines soon after takeoff; all 24 on board are killed.

title: Nagerkovil school bombing, is carried out by the Sri Lanka Air Force in which at least 34 die, most of them ethnic Tamil schoolchildren.
text: Nagerkovil school bombing, is carried out by the Sri Lanka Air Force in which at least 34 die, most of them ethnic Tamil schoolchildren.

title: At least 75 people are killed in a suicide bombing at a Christian church in Peshawar, Pakistan.
text: At least 75 people are killed in a suicide bombing at a Christian church in Peshawar, Pakistan.
